# Measurement

**Structure**

A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Measurement<UnitType> where UnitType : Unit
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement] object represents a quantity and unit of measure. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement] type provides a programmatic interface to converting measurements into different units, as well as calculating the sum or difference between two measurements.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement] objects are initialized with a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] object and double value. [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Measurement] objects are immutable, and cannot be changed after being created.

Measurements support a large set of operators, including `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, and a full set of comparison operators.

## Creating a Measurement

- **init(value:unit:)**: Create a `Measurement` given a specified value and unit.

## Accessing the Value and Units

- **unit**: The unit component of the measurement.
- **value**: The value component of the measurement.

## Converting to Other Units

- **convert(to:)**: Converts the measurement to the specified unit.
- **converted(to:)**: Returns a new measurement created by converting to the specified unit.

## Operating on a Measurement

- ***(_:_:)**: Multiply a scalar value by a measurement.
- ***(_:_:)**: Multiply a measurement by a scalar value.
- **+(_:_:)**: Add two measurements.
- **+(_:_:)**: Adds two measurements of the same dimension.
- **-(_:_:)**: Subtract two measurements of the same Unit.
- **-(_:_:)**: Subtract two measurements of the same Dimension.
- **/(_:_:)**: Divide a scalar value by a measurement.
- **/(_:_:)**: Divide a measurement by a scalar value.

## Formatting a Measurement

- **formatted()**: Generates a locale-aware string representation of a measurement using the default measurement format style.
- **formatted(_:)**: Generates a locale-aware string representation of a measurement using the provided measurement format style.
- **Measurement.FormatStyle**: A type that provides localized representations of measurements.
- **Measurement.AttributedStyle**: A type that provides localized representations of measurements with an attributed string.

## Comparing Measurements

- **<(_:_:)**: Compare two measurements of the same `Unit`.

## Using Reference Types

- **NSMeasurement**: A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.

## Type Aliases

- **Measurement.Specification**
- **Measurement.UnwrappedType**
- **Measurement.ValueType**

## Type Properties

- **defaultResolverSpecification**

## Default Implementations

- **Comparable Implementations**
- **Equatable Implementations**

## Essentials

- **NSMeasurement**: A numeric quantity labeled with a unit of measure, with support for unit conversion and unit-aware calculations.
- **Unit**: An abstract class representing a unit of measure.
- **Dimension**: An abstract class representing a dimensional unit of measure.

## Conforms To

- Comparable
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- ElectricityInsightMeasure
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- ReferenceConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
